About us     PRINER is the new name of Mills|Si, a leading Brazilian company in the industrial services and maintenance sector, focused on results-based management, commitment to safety and innovative technological solutions.        Our Solutions             Access  The execution of all work starts and ends with Access, and we are specialists in this area.  Find out        Materials Engineering and Testing Laboratories  Laboratory testing ensures the quality and safety of materials in sectors such as sugar and ethanol, metal-mechanic, food and beverage, pulp and paper, oil and gas, equipment manufacturing, and more.  Find out        Geotechnics  Priner has extensive experience in Geotechnics, consistently combining modern solutions, high technical capability, and solid expertise in executing a wide range of services. One of the main technologies used by our company is the execution of injected piles, also known as pressurized anchoring.  Find out        Habitat  The pressurized habitat is the ideal solution in terms of cost and operation at sites with strict safety requirements, such as offshore oil production rigs, refineries and petrochemical plants and terminals.  Find out        Integrity Engineering and Inspection  The Integrity Engineering and Inspection team at Grupo Priner is composed of qualified professionals and equipped with cutting-edge technology to deliver the best solutions in conventional and advanced inspection techniques for equipment assessment.  Find out        Inspection and Diagnostics  Internal inspection of water, sewage, and other effluent networks carried out using robotic technology to assess the actual condition of the installations, as well as maintenance, cleaning, and descaling needs.  Find out        Thermal insulation  Efficient solutions for conventional and portable thermal insulation systems, firewalls and acoustic systems, offering maximum productivity and quality.  Find out        Industrial paintwork  A qualified technical team develops tailor-made solutions in all market segments, taking into account the reduction of environmental risks and increase the projected life of the plants.  Find out        Priner has arrived in the US  We offer a broad portfolio of Integrity and Advanced Engineering Solutions for Industrial Equipment in the United States, ensuring the safety and reliability of your assets.  Find out        Pipeline Rehabilitation by Trenchless Method (MND)  Technique used to restore, reinforce, or replace underground infrastructure networks, such as water, sewage, gas, and drainage systems, without the need for extensive excavations.  Find out        Structural Repair and Reinforcement  Priner operates in the infrastructure sector with a focus on solving its clientsâ structural issues while minimizing the impact on their operations.  Find out               Locations   We operate throughout Brazil . MAHLE Career           Responsibility MAHLE is committed to bringing sustainable development and technical progress into perfect alignment in the interest of efficient, environmentally friendly mobility. In doing so, we strive to reconcile the economic success of our company with the requirements of the environment, society, and our employees. Sustainability at MAHLE           Aftermarket MAHLE Lifecycle and Mobility is the business unit specializing in spare parts and services for the aftermarket. It uses the expertise from original equipment series production for its established product range and additional competence in electrification and digitalization and supplies partners in the trade, workshops, and engine repair shops. MAHLE Lifecycle and Mobility           MAHLE - We shape future mobility!       MAHLE is a leading international development partner and supplier to the automotive industry with customers in both passenger car and commercial vehicle sectors. Founded in 1920, the technology group is working on the climate-neutral mobility of tomorrow, with a focus on the strategic areas of electrification and thermal management as well as further technologies to reduce CO 2 emissions, such as fuel cells or highly efficient, clean combustion engines that also run on renewable fuels, such as hydrogen. Today, one in every two vehicles globally is equipped with MAHLE components. Sustainability Report - 2024            Download Portuguese version               Download English version            See previous versions                Our initiatives             Environmental Solutions        Water and Energy Efficiency        Reforestation Area           We manufacture in-house collectors for selective waste collection, using them in our areas, which have been developed with process waste, such as leftover fiber fabric, resins and hardeners, presenting a sustainable solution in the final disposal of waste; We have implemented various other internal reuse actions, including the reuse of plastic accessories from the production process, paper/cardboard, among others; We have actions aimed at the circular economy, in order to minimize the impact of plastic on nature; We choose biodegradable products in our purchases, always looking for those that cause the least environmental impact. We have completed the construction of a new Water and Effluent Treatment Plant with the capacity to serve a community of 13,000 inhabitants. Equipped with Reverse Osmosis technology, this plant allows for the reuse of water and contributes to reducing consumption of this resource; We purchase 100% energy from renewable sources for use in our manufacturing plants, and we are certified with I-REC, which verifies this acquisition.            We maintain a reforestation area with thousands of native plants, with the aim of promoting preservation and care for the environment. It plays an important role in the renewable energy industry. Founded in 2010, Aeris quickly established itself as a reference in the sector, thanks to its combination of advanced technology, strategic location and a highly qualified team. Created during a period of significant growth in the renewable energy sector in Brazil and worldwide, the company positions itself as an important player in the wind energy production chain, one of the fastest growing segments in clean energy generation. Aeris’ headquarters are located in the state of CearÃ¡, in the PecÃ©m Industrial and Port Complex region â a strategic region due to its good winds that enhance the generation of clean energy, in addition to its proximity to the coast, facilitating the transportation and logistics of its products. Aeris stands out for the use of cutting-edge technologies in its manufacturing processes. The company continually invests in research and development to improve the efficiency and quality of its wind turbine blades. In addition, Aeris adopts sustainable manufacturing practices, seeking to minimize its environmental impact and contribute to the global transition to cleaner and renewable energy sources. Aeris is a world-class company in the manufacturing of wind turbine blades and, since its founding in 2010, has based its activities on principles of ethics and integrity. We believe that this is the only way to achieve solid and prosperous growth. By assuming the position of an ethical company, we commit to respecting human rights, acting responsibly in the maintenance and protection of the environment, guaranteeing the rights of the community in our business environment, as well as society as a whole, and fighting any and all types of corruption. Our premise is zero tolerance for any and all types of harassment, regardless of the form it takes. The Aeris Code of Conduct represents much more than a set of rules: it is, in fact, the personal commitment of each one of us to act ethically and to safeguard Aeris’ reputation as a company with integrity, that respects human rights and the environment, and that focuses on consistent and lasting results, combating any types of harassment and corruption. Therefore, everyone must be responsible for what is OURS: assets, information, image and reputation. Everyone must ensure that our assets endure, and that we are always within an ecosystem where ethics and integrity are a natural part of our daily lives.          Relationships with business partners (third parties)            Our third parties* are also an essential part of achieving excellence in our products. Therefore, we must maintain a relationship of respect, trust and integrity, and this relationship must be a two-way street, in order to be sustainable. The same applies to Aeris’ relationship with public agents, for all levels of government.  *Third parties: Any individual or legal entity that is not an employee of Aeris, or that is hired to assist in the performance of its activities, such as partners, representatives, customers, suppliers, service providers in general, consultants, outsourced workers, agents acting on behalf of Aeris.          Social Responsibility            Our concern for the environment and society is part of our business, with a focus on renewable energy with an exceptionally low environmental impact. Thus, Sustainability, the Environment and Community Leadership help us to be an increasingly better company, making the world a better place.                            Corporate Governance and Compliance      Our fundamental principle is respect for the law. Therefore, compliance with the legal systems and Aeris policies is the basic requirement for honest conduct and should always be prioritized under any circumstances.            Reporting Channel      Aeris has an outsourced Reporting Channel to ensure confidentiality and anonymity for the complainant, as well as the confidentiality of information. The complainant can report the incident through the website www.canaldedenuncia.com.br/aeris or by calling 0800-882-0611. If the report is filed via the website, it is possible to attach audio, video, photo files, and even other types of documents in DOCX, XLS, CSV, PDF, PNG, JPG, MP4, WAV, PPT, TXT formats, up to 1 GB in size. When filing a report, either through the website or by calling 0800, a six-digit protocol number will be provided so that the complainant can monitor the progress of the analysis of the report, if desired. For those who filed the report via 0800, the protocol number can also be used to access the system and include evidence such as image, audio, video files, etc.                  Complaints channel          www.canaldedenuncia.com.br/aeris                     Phone       0800-882-0611                 When making a complaint, Aeris guarantees confidentiality, anonymity and ensures that no retaliation will occur as a result of the complaint. If the complainant chooses to identify himself, his identity will be kept completely confidential, in accordance with the company’s internal policies. Aeris has a principle of zero tolerance for unethical conduct. On June 14, 2022, we shared the Aeris Culture with our entire team, along with our Manifesto and our Values. Since then, various initiatives have been carried out to reinforce this alignment in all areas of the company. Our values guide us in every decision and attitude: We develop and care for our people, We focus on quality and We generate value. These pillars express who we are, how we work and the impact we seek to generate every day.                 Learn about our values:               We Develop and Care for Our People             Our people make everything happen! We believe that these minds and hands together build a world powered by clean and renewable energy for everyone. We live our values, which is why we develop and care for our people. Our goal is to build an environment that guarantees safety, learning and trust, promoting the future of both our employees and the surrounding communities.               We Focus on Quality             Quality allows us to exist! We want to be recognized as the best supplier to our customers. We will continue to focus on quality, complying with standards, having discipline with good planning and acting with zeal and determination to do the right thing, in order to achieve our goals and contribute to the sustainability of our business.               We Create Value             Together we deliver more! We collaborate proactively, helping each other to grow together. We create value, promoting an environment of collaboration, commitment and focus on business, this makes us #SerTÃ£oAeris. The attributes of our Culture are in a Manifesto, which summarizes the way we move towards a more sustainable world powered by clean energy.                THE WAY OF BEING SO AERIS .                             Cultural Manifesto      We exist to help build a more sustainable world powered by clean energy. We strive every day to ensure the sustainability of our business, generating consistent results. We respect and value our employees and their families. They are the ones who make everything happen! We value ethics and transparency in our relationships and in dealing with problems. We are determined and always work to achieve the quality of our products and services. We want to be recognized as the best supplier to our customers. We are aware of our social role and promote actions for the development of our surroundings.             Cultural Transformation      To give legitimacy and fluidity to processes, Aeris has strived to make roles and responsibilities clear throughout the governance structure. Thus, the president and directors were named sponsors and ambassadors of values. The Human Resources area became the guardian, responsible for managing and executing the work. Finally, some employees received the title of Transformation Agents, in order to disseminate the Company's way of being. Bagageiro / Cesta Frontal Blocagem Rápida de Roda Câmbio - Instruções de Utilização Freios Refletores / Campainha Pedais e Rodinhas Laterais Partes de Uma Bicicleta Nomenclatura Técnica Manutenção Procedimentos Guidão Roda Dianteira / Pára-lama Dianteiro Segurança Selim Termo de Garantia Termo de Garantia: Bicicletas Monark S/A autorizará a realização dos serviços em garantia sem ônus de mão de obra e peças, somente nas oficinas autorizadas. O proprietário deste produto será responsável pelas despesas de transporte e locomoção do mesmo até uma oficina autorizada Monark de sua preferência. Para a necessidade de atendimento em garantia, faz-se necessário que o proprietário preencha corretamente os campos destinados aos dados pessoais e do produto, existente na respectiva ficha de serviço. A nota fiscal de compra deverá ser anexada à mesma quando do encaminhamento do produto à oficina autorizada.  â  Bicicletas Monark S/A garante reposição de componentes de seus produtos que apresentarem defeitos de material ou de fabricação no prazo de 90 (noventa) dias, conforme disposição da LEI 8078 do código de defesa do consumidor, contados à partir da data de compra constante na nota fiscal. A garantia é intransferível, não podendo, sob qualquer alegação, ser ampliada ou prorrogada.  â  Bicicletas Monark S/A não considera defeito de fabricação o desgaste normal de peças, tais como: pneus, câmaras, pedais, corrente de transmissão, sapatas de freios, caixas de esferas, descoloração da pintura e corrosão.  â  Bicicletas Monark S/A não se responsabiliza pelos defeitos ou danos ocasionados por acidente, uso indevido, falta de manutenção, agentes da natureza, transporte e armazenamento deficientes, alteração nas características do produto, má montagem, reparos efetuados fora das oficinas autorizadas, bem como pela utilização de componentes que não tenham sido fornecidos pela própria Monark.  â  Obs.: A garantia está condicionada à montagem e uso do produto. Para realizá-la corretamente, leia com atenção o manual de instruções.  â  Para obter maiores informações sobre nossa rede de serviços autorizados, ou esclarecer quaisquer dúvidas com relação à nossa linha de produtos, favor entrar em contato com a Central de Informações Monark (CIM), através do telefone: 0800 015 50 15. ATENÇÃO: Anote na nota fiscal o número do quadro para facilitar a identificação em caso de furto ou extravio. Essa numeração está localizada na abraçadeira do selim, ou na parte inferior da caixa do movimento central. Copyright © 2024 Bicicletas Monark SA. Todos os direitos reservados. Bagageiro / Cesta Frontal Blocagem Rápida de Roda Câmbio - Instruções de Utilização Freios Refletores / Campainha Pedais e Rodinhas Laterais Partes de Uma Bicicleta Nomenclatura Técnica Manutenção Procedimentos Guidão Roda Dianteira / Pára-lama Dianteiro Segurança Selim Termo de Garantia Manutenção Procedimentos: Corrente: limpe com querosene e lubrifique periodicamente com óleo fino (máquina de costura). Não utilize outros tipos de óleo ou graxa.  â  Pintura: Lave a bicicleta com uma mistura de água e querosene, enxague e seque bem. Não utilize solvente que possa atacar a pintura. Evite jatos de água. Quando utilizar sua Monark na praia,lave-a em seguida com água doce.  â  Cromados: Limpe com cera polidora. Porcas e Parafusos: Verifique e reaperte se necessário, exceto os de regulagens específicas, tais como do câmbio.  â  Câmbio/Descarrilhador: Periodicamente limpe com querosene e lubrifique o sistema com óleo fino, retirando o excesso. mantenha ajustadas as alavancas de câmbio. Pneus: Ande sempre com os pneus calibrados. A pressão diminui normalmente em função da porosidade da câmara. Observe a pressão máxima recomendada para cada tipo de pneu, conforme tabela ao lado e acima. Alguns procedimentos de manutenção mais sofisticados, demandam apurado conhecimento técnico, ferramentas específicas e experiência. A MONARK A empresa foi fundada em abril de 1948 com a denominação de Monark Indústria e Comércio Ltda, atuando inicialmente como importadora e montadora, passando posteriormente a ser fabricante de bicicletas.  â  Em fevereiro de 1951 adquiriu área na Chácara Santo Antonio, em São Paulo, para onde foram transferidas a fábrica e o escritório.  â  Em 2008 transferiu as atividades para o Distrito Industrial Domingos Giomi, localizado em Indaiatuba/SP.  â  A produção da empresa inclui a linha MTB (de aço e de alumínio), linha Transporte (modelos Barra Circular e Tropical), linha Passeio (modelo Brisa) e linha infantojuvenil (modelos BMX, BRISA e KIDS). SUSTENTABILIDADE A bicicleta é mais do que conhecida como meio de transporte sustentável, que não congestiona, não polui e traz benefícios para a saúde.  â  A Monark dá mais um passo reforçando o compromisso com a sustentabilidade, através da parceria com a Eureciclo. www.eureciclo.com.br Copyright © 2024 Bicicletas Monark SA. Guided by the belief that beauty can be created with purpose, the Company offers beauty and well-being products and services with innovation, sustainability, and positive impact at their core.  With operations in 14 Latin American countries and an omnichannel business model, its products are available through a network of over 3 million beauty consultants across the region, as well as through e-commerce, mobile app, and more than 1,000 physical stores.  In addition to the Natura and Avon brands, the Company also operates the financial platform Emana Pay and the beauty and wellness services platform Bluma.       Commitment to positive impact and regeneration    Large corporations can drive meaningful change in the world by leveraging their assets, expertise, and relationships to create better ways of living and doing business. As a network, we are committed to innovation in the pursuit of regenerative solutions that address the planetâs most pressing social and environmental challenges.      Our Essence  Reason for Being  Our Reason for Being is to create and market products and services that promote Well-Being-Well    Well-Being  Is the individualâs harmonious and fulfilling relationship with oneself and oneâs body    Being-Well  Is the individualâs empathetic, meaningful, and joyful connection with others, with the nature of which they are a part, and with the whole.    Beliefs  Life is a network of relationships â nothing in the universe exists in isolation. Everything is interdependent. We believe that recognizing the value of relationships is the foundation for a profound human transformation, one that elevates peace, solidarity, and life in all its forms. The continuous pursuit of self-improvement fuels the development of individuals, organizations, and society. Truthfulness is the cornerstone of enduring relationships. The greater the diversity among the parts, the greater the richness and vitality of the whole. The pursuit of beauty, a natural human desire, should be free from prejudice and manipulation. The company is a living organism â a dynamic system of relationships. Its value and longevity are tied to its ability to contribute to societal progress and sustainable development.    Vision  Natura, through its business conduct, the quality of the relationships it builds, and its products and services, will become a globally recognized brand â aligned with a community of people committed to building a better world through deeper connections with themselves, with others, with the nature of which they are a part, and with the whole. This means its operations will generate a positive impact for individuals, communities, and the planet, all while driving business growth.  Regeneration goes beyond simply offsetting or mitigating negative impacts. For Natura, its business will be considered regenerative when it creates a positive impact across each of four distinct capitals: financial, human, social, and natural.  For several years, the company has been transparently measuring its progress and impact through the Integrated Profit and Loss (iP&L) , an innovative management tool that assigns a monetary value to its socio-environmental impacts.  In 2024, the iP&L demonstrated that for every R$ 1 re v e n u e , N a t u r a g e n er a t e d R$ 2.50 in positive societal impact. The company has set an even more ambitious target for 2030: to generate R$ 4 o f im p a c t f ore v ery R$ 1 of revenue.  The “2025-2050 Vision” is the document that outlines the ambitions and the roadmap for Natura to achieve its goal of becoming a regenerative company.    Read more      A holistic view of our business  We see our business through the lens of a regenerative mindset. Life is at the core, and nature is the whole that contains everything. Bridging the two are all the relationships we build to conduct our operations, just as depicted in the diagram.                Background  Back in 2014, Natura launched its "2050 Sustainability Vision," driven by the aspiration for its collective activities to leave a positive environmental, social, and economic impact on the planet.  The current "2025-2050 Vision" is an evolution of this commitment, grounded in a new mindset: regeneration. The "2025-2050 Vision" also incorporates the scope of the "Commitment to Life," which was launched in 2020, and unifies all of the company's socio-environmental goals. Naturaâs commitment to governance has deep roots and was significantly strengthened in 2005 with the creation of the Corporate Governance Office within Natura CosmÃ©ticos.
